page.title: 14Davern Workwear
page.content: A visit to the{Davern Workwear, {Easterly Manufacturing Company}helped us to see how a{factory works. We saw a{boiler suit}being made. First of all{cardboard patterns}were drawn round on{.x}paper.Then all the patterns were cut out by one man who showed us his{chain mail}glove.This protects his hand from the{blade}which can cut through{200 layers}of material at one time just as if it were butter. Next the{pattern pieces}were moved to the{machine room}on trolleys.There we saw a pocket and all the garment pieces joined together.We went to the {finishing room}to watch a lady using a {stud machine}putting{press studs}on the suits.She did it faster than we could believe. All the{workwear }was checked,then packed ready for sale.If anything was wrong it went back to the person who made it. Michelle Baker.
